snippet: A week after the plane disappeared, the trail is even colder as the search now sprawls from the snowy peaks of the Himalayas to the empty expanses of the southern Indian Ocean.
abstract: Long series of errors and delays, like missed radar blip, by Malaysian government have made the geographically vast and technologically complex task of finding Malaysian Airlines Flight 370 far more difficult.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and MICHAEL FORSYTHE
byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Sepang, Nicola Clark from Paris, and Matthew L. Wald from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A week after the plane disappeared, the trail is even colder as the search now sprawls from the snowy peaks of the Himalayas to the empty expanses of the southern Indian Ocean.

headline.main: Series of Errors by Malaysia Mounts, Complicating the Task of Finding Flight 370
headline.print_headline: Series of Missteps by Malaysia Mounts, Complicating the Task of Finding Flight 370
